definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: For a specific health problem, consult your physician for guidance.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个特定的健康问题，要征询医生的指导。

sentences.english: The Chief Executive must consult the Executive Council before dissolving the Legislative Council.
sentences.chinese: 行政长官在解散立法会前，须征询行政会议的意见。

sentences.english: Any oversea clients please send email to me or contact me directly.
sentences.chinese: 外洋客户亦可间接征询我店。

sentences.english: All the other hardware engineers on the team, except for Woz, usually came to Wendell for advice.
sentences.chinese: 团队里除了沃茨，都经常向他征询意见。

sentences.english: This type of letter is an outgoing letter and may be called a "First Inquiry".
sentences.chinese: 这类信件就是发函，也可称为“首次征询”。

sentences.english: They have been circularized with regard to the new design.
sentences.chinese: 关于新的设计问题，已向他们征询过意见。

sentences.english: After the speech, he invited questions and suggestions from us.
sentences.chinese: 讲完话之后，他征询我们的问题和意见。

sentences.english: She asked Wesley to recommend someone for the position.
sentences.chinese: 她征询卫斯里究竟推荐何人来担当此重任。

sentences.english: See-through top may also be sought out as the season becomes hotter.
sentences.chinese: 见通过自上而下也可征询随着赛季的进行变得更热。

sentences.english: The government has ostentatiously solicited public opinion about the change.
sentences.chinese: 政府还装摸作样的就此次调整征询公众的意见。

definition: to solicit/to seek/to request (opinions, feedback etc)/to petition
to consider/to deliberate/to fill up a cup to the brim
to answer/to reply/Reply to: (in email header)
variant of 答覆|答复[da2 fu4]
